title: "Oh you're gold" Vent Thread
body:
What the hell is wrong with people? Honestly. I want to know. Why is this community made of so many sociopaths? And what's with their fixation on people being gold?

So my ping decided to be stable today so I wanted to see how playing a normal game by myself would go. It's rare I have a nice day where it isn't going up and down from 60 to 200. So I'm just playing my game as Quinn ADC. We're having fun. Nice jungle pow-wow with the enemy team before the game starts. And then I get screwed over in bot lane by the enemy Zed with no MIA. Me and my Thresh die and the tower goes with us. Ok, whatever, it sucks but it happens.

I'm farming trying to catch back up and my team starts fighting in mid. Our Azir's laughing saying I'm on "tilt" for not joining. When I told him I was just trying to farm back up he goes "Oh, you're gold. That explains it."... This happens to me in like half of my normal games. My NORMAL games! Why the hell do people always pull this card? Why do they look at rank in the first place? It's so damn frustrating.

Of course I'm pretty pissed now but me and my Thresh explain to him that I was just going to farm to be relevant again. He of course replies to this with more douche-baggery. Then his buddy Darius chimes in with "You don't get it Quinn. You don't get it. You don't have enough experience. You don't know how to make plays that aren't completely r%%%%%ed." This is quickly followed by a circle-jerk between him and Azir about how shitty I am for being gold.

I got fucking mad. I ragequit. I told the enemy team to report them and myself for leaving. I know, it isn't fair to the other people playing, and I could have muted them once they started talking shit, but I just can't stand playing the game like that. As a sensitive guy who got bullied growing up it seriously makes me shake, heat up, and gives me a migraine. I just can't deal with it. What the hell is wrong with the people? Why are people in my blind-pick games always screwing with gold players? This just makes me want to finish my promos to platinum so I can never hear this bullshit again...

Sorry for the rant... I'm just so tired of running into people like this. I know I shouldn't let it get to me, but it puts me into a really shitty mood. Like I've been typing this for twenty minutes and I'm still stressed about it. Please people, stop being so damn mean for no good reason. My anxiety would really appreciate it.

TL;DR Community sucks. Especially to gold players. Giving me grey hairs.

The thing that frustrates me about the games "tiers" or "divisions" is what they stand for. You have Challenger, Masters, Diamond, Platinum, Gold, Silver, Bronze.  Challenger - Diamond is literally 1-2% of the server.  Like you said, Gold is roughly 30% of the server. So like in my mind, i think hmmm gold.. must make u like average or something? But really it means holy shit! ur top 1/3 of the players. Idk it has just really bothered me, maybe because I have played this game so long and still am silver. like in my mind, bronze means your new, silver means your better than the new players but need work, Gold would be average, and then up from there. But that is not what it means in this game at all. 

The other weird thing about this game is the rank resets at the beginning of the season. Its fine and dandy for those Challenger - Diamond players cuz lets face it, they play a fuck ton of solo rank and now they can finally find games. But it really messes up things on the lower end of the spectrum. Like my cousin, who has always been bronze. He went like 8-2 in his promos this season (ended season 4 in like bronze 1 or 2). Its like damn dude nice! good work!. Well he got bronze 4.... Which is w/e, but my buddy who was silver 3 last season did bad in placements and also got bronze 4.. You also see gold players drop to bronze at the start of the season. So wtf are bronze players supposed to do? There is no where for them to go but down or wait half the year until people get back to their old ranks. Idk, just seems weird. Then you have these new players who dont know shit come in and play 10 provisional games and automatically get put into silver since they started playing ranked with only a few months left. Then they tell their friends "hahah I got silver and I just got 30 like a month ago". Then they got 2-13 (as someone said above) and are in silver 4 but really should be low bronze.

I just feel ranks in this game can be meaningful if you play a lot of games and want to judge yourself vs your pers on average. But at the same time it is not the tell tale sign of much, because obviously ranks can fluctuate a lot especially at the lower elos.

Well once you account for people playing more than one name 30% is prob 50% at best, so good is average probably, plat is competitive and pretty good, diamond is really good to great players. Masters and challenger is like pro-am level.

My response to:
> I'm farming trying to catch back up and my team starts fighting in mid. Our Azir's laughing saying I'm on "tilt" for not joining. When I told him I was just trying to farm back up he goes **"Oh, you're gold. That explains it."** ... 

I have a sad story, that I will try to cut down in length. Please tell me if this is okay to you.

So here I am Queuing up for Solo-Que, and I get into a game. The enemy team (which I did not look up, unlike them.) have one Gold and one Platinum. This means the Platinum player had Que'd up with lower levels. Which is not okay because the MMR is split and I have to endure this game. They didn't say anything until their Yasuo walks into my blue and tries to take it, and we get first blood. I said ''Okay?'' - I knew I shouldn't but I wanted to know why. The response was something along the lines of ''You aren't allowed to type''. At this point I thought he was just an asshole because maybe something happened on the enemy team. But that wasn't the case... I also didn't mute him and here is why:

The Plat and Gold start harassing me ''Because you are Bronze haha you don't get to type.'' --- this butterfly effected all the way to my Ally Top Laner, and he starts saying stupid things like ''Wow they are right" and "You move like Bronze player''. What the hell does that even mean? That legitimate, if I read that out loud, sounds like what a 10 year old would say. 

Now of course I have someone (who is Silver 5 by the way) telling me I play like a Bronze player. I feel like garbage because I can't say anything without being harassed on both sides.

The enemies are purposely dying every so often, then saying that it doesn't matter if we are fed because I'm bad. 

So what really threw me off the edge, is that I get top fed early on, around 3-4 kills. But guess what he builds against 4 APs and 1 AD? ... armor... The Plat notices this and asks why, then saying ''#JustSilverThings'' --- okay, that's awesome. I then ask why and what he says just made me rethink my life ''I don't even care for this game.'' ... I felt like I was back in Pre-School again. I can't even react to that! That is borderline harassment on multiple levels. I did the best I could and we were doing fine, but he insists that we lose because ''ur bronze.'' 

I needed a hug and I felt like crying.
I'm pretty sure ranks are a badge of skill and effort, not a birthright. :(

**I honestly can't and don't want play Ranked for 4 reasons.**

Ranked is like that. The people who climb are the ones who consistently play better. It just goes back to the frequently cited "80%" math about having toxic players in a team. If you are NEVER toxic, only 80% of your team has the possibility to be, while 100% of the enemy team does. Skill works the same way. If you are ALWAYS good, you only have to worry about 4 others playing badly, while the enemy team has 5 people to worry about. Cliche as hell, I know, but that's how it goes.

Doesn't matter what rank you are you're always gonna get crap from people. Honestly, this is a good reason to ignore ranked entirely. I'll admit that even unranked, I'm more secure about my play and find most players that aren't at least Gold 1 to play very poorly. I constantly see teammates and enemies alike that commonly have the same bad play habits, and those don't usually disappear until Plat/Diamond for most people (and even then, some of the "high elo" streams I see just make me facepalm). The point is that you should expect this kind of thing. Not just for being under Plat, but also because it's the internet... and LoL... and this community. Just gotta thicken up that skin and shrug that sh~t off.

One last thing. Don't rely on MIA pings or chat. **Only rely on yourself.** Watch your map constantly. If you go 5 seconds without glancing at it, you're doing it wrong. That isn't just "elitism" either. That's one of the fastest/easiest ways to improve your play (along with proper warding, since it increases the value of your map awareness).

I'll admit.. I have gotten to into this game and have been a flaming rager to people. Mostly because it's easier to be hateful towards someone, especially if they're feeding/threw the game. But every day I'm trying hard to control myself and just be nice, because hurting someone else isn't going to make you less angry, and getting that angry over a game that has very little impact on your actual life is silly in the first place.

Either way, it seems you don't really see consistent, solid, "clean" play from people until mid Plat. Dunno why.

Everybody thinks that because you aren't challenger/ranked higher than them, you must be first match out of downloading the game. Or have the knowledge as such. It's ridiculous.

"oh that only worked because you're in gold"
"oh once you get higher you can't play that champ, it only works up to gold"

their excuse is that everything you do only works because "you're in gold" and I hate it.

There is an element of truth to such statements when used correctly, but people do just sort of blanket anything they disagree with into it. My favorite are the "X champ is unviable" guys; yep, that's why we see jungle Poppy in Diamond/Challenger games reasonably frequently, right? Seriously, keep an eye out for it on spectator mode and streams. It's hilarious.

You shouldn't care what your team says or does. Make the best of it and try to win. Chances are that the other team is having similar problems, so by simply being nice to everyone regardless you put your team in a better position. It's a video game, have fun,

I once got a complaint from an enemy laner saying that I "bought my account" even after he went 0 - 5 in lane and proceeded to win because our jungler had internet issues. I didn't even typed a single word into /all chat that game and he just started saying "nice bought account", "how much did you buy it for?", etc. during the last few minutes of the game. The irony is, he was a plat player and I was in diamond. I still got trash talked, it happens. My advice is just to *shake it off* (sorry I just had to make a tswift reference) and to try maintain a positive attitude. Because sure what he did was wrong, and deserves every punishment he is entitled to, but you still have 3 other members of your team counting on you. And not everyone is a jerk, and sometimes it also helps if you have someone you know who is very supportive and cooperative to play with you. I hope that alleviates some of your anxiety, and I wish you well in your future games.

TL;DR: it sucks, it happens, try to stay positive, there are plenty of other nice people you can play with, and choose them to play with you!
